issue.title: [C++] RAPIDJSON_INCLUDE_DIR not set (Windows + Anaconda)
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5235](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5235). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I'm trying to build Arrow in debug mode on Windows with some dependencies installed via conda. Unfortunately I ultimately get the following error:
```Java

[...]
-- RapidJSON found. Headers: C:/Miniconda3/envs/arrow/Library/include
[...]
-- Could NOT find Backtrace (missing: Backtrace_LIBRARY Backtrace_INCLUDE_DIR)
CMake Error: The following variables are used in this project, but they are set
to NOTFOUND.
Please set them or make sure they are set and tested correctly in the CMake file
s:
RAPIDJSON_INCLUDE_DIR
   used as include directory in directory C:/t/arrow/cpp
[ etc. ]
```

RapidJSON 1.1.0 is installed from Anaconda.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5235?focusedCommentId=17394017) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
I haven't tried to reproduce in a long time, and nobody else complained. Closing.
